page.title: 13St. Stephen's Church Lympne.
page.content: The original twelfth century Church has been much enlarged and repaired over the centuries and it stands next to Lympne Castle. When I visited the Church it was unlocked; it was decorated with fresh flowers, the tiled floors were polished and everything smelt sweet and clean. On the table there were leaflets, the Parish Magazine among them, from which I gathered news of the activities in the surrounding villages: confirmations, Remembrance Day, Parish Council meetings, Guides and the Women's Institute. In the Children's Corner there was a display of collages: "Mummie doing Things" and "The Tempest".Handworked kneelers lay on the pews, and I had the feeling that everyone had only just left.
